Discovery Alert: A Third Planet in Keple.title: Discovery Alert: A Third Planet in Kepler-47 System
Discovery Alert: A Third Planet in Keple.desc: Astronomers have discovered a third planet in the Kepler-47 system, securing the system’s title as the most interesting of the binary-star worlds.

High School Senior Uncovers Potential fo.title: High School Senior Uncovers Potential for Hundreds of Earth-Like Planets in Kepler Data
High School Senior Uncovers Potential fo.desc: An 18-year-old high school senior has won a $250,000 prize for calculating the potential for finding more planets outside our solar system, called exoplanets, using data from NASA’s Kepler space telescope.

Discovery Alert! Kepler's First Planet C.title: Discovery Alert! Kepler's First Planet Candidate Confirmed, 10 Years Later
Discovery Alert! Kepler's First Planet C.desc: This newly-confirmed exoplanet is a massive hot Jupiter that whips around its star every 3.85 days. From the surface, the star would appear 60 times larger in diameter than the Sun as seen from Earth.

Kepler\u2019s Final Image Shows A Galaxy.title: Kepler’s Final Image Shows A Galaxy Full Of Possibilities
Kepler\u2019s Final Image Shows A Galaxy.desc: This image taken on Sept. 25, 2018 by NASA’s Kepler space telescope is the final record of Kepler’s full field of view before the depletion of fuel permanently ended the work of this historic planet-hunting spacecraft.

Tour Alien Worlds with New Multimedia Tr.title: Tour Alien Worlds with New Multimedia Treats
Tour Alien Worlds with New Multimedia Tr.desc: While you can't actually travel to a planet outside our solar system, these new multimedia treats are the next-best thing.

Kepler\u2019s Supernova Experiment Captu.title: Kepler’s Supernova Experiment Captures First Moments of a Dying Star
Kepler\u2019s Supernova Experiment Captu.desc: In a galaxy far away, an old star exploded and became a supernova. About 170 million years later on Feb. 4, 2018, the light emanating from the explosion was received by an arsenal of high-powered telescopes.

Kepler Space Telescope Bid \u2018Goodnig.title: Kepler Space Telescope Bid ‘Goodnight’ With Final Set of Commands
Kepler Space Telescope Bid \u2018Goodnig.desc: On Thursday evening, NASA’s Kepler space telescope received its final set of commands to disconnect communications with Earth. The “goodnight” commands finalize the spacecraft’s transition into retirement, which began on Oct. 30 with NASA’s announcement that Kepler had run out of fuel and could no longer conduct science.

NASA Retires Kepler Space Telescope, Pas.title: NASA Retires Kepler Space Telescope, Passes Planet-Hunting Torch
NASA Retires Kepler Space Telescope, Pas.desc: After nine years in deep space collecting data that indicate our sky to be filled with billions of hidden planets – more planets even than stars – NASA’s Kepler space telescope has run out of fuel needed for further science operations.

Top Science Results from the Kepler Miss.title: Top Science Results from the Kepler Mission
Top Science Results from the Kepler Miss.desc: A summary of major science results from NASA's Kepler telescope.

Kepler By the Numbers \u2013 Mission Sta.title: Kepler By the Numbers – Mission Statistics
Kepler By the Numbers \u2013 Mission Sta.desc: The Kepler space telescope is done with its work collecting astounding science data showing there are more planets than stars in our galaxy. Here’s a round-up of what Kepler has achieved.

How Earth Climate Models Help Scientists.title: How Earth Climate Models Help Scientists Picture Life on Unimaginable Worlds
How Earth Climate Models Help Scientists.desc: Thousands of computers at NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center are tasked with running sophisticated climate models to predict Earth’s future climate. Collectively known as NASA's Discover supercomputer, they’re now also sussing out whether any of the more than 4,000 curiously weird planets beyond our solar system could support life.

NASA's Kepler Witnesses Vampire Star Sys.title: NASA's Kepler Witnesses Vampire Star System Undergoing Super-Outburst
NASA's Kepler Witnesses Vampire Star Sys.desc: NASA's Kepler spacecraft was designed to find exoplanets by looking for stars that dim as a planet crosses the star's face. Fortuitously, the same design makes it ideal for spotting other objects that brighten or dim over time. A new search of Kepler archival data has uncovered an unusual super-outburst from a previously unknown dwarf nova.

NASA\u2019s TESS Enables Breakthrough St.title: NASA’s TESS Enables Breakthrough Study of Perplexing Stellar Pulsations
NASA\u2019s TESS Enables Breakthrough St.desc: Astronomers have detected elusive pulsation patterns in dozens of young, rapidly rotating stars thanks to data from NASA’s Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).

AAS Names 29 NASA-Affiliated Legacy Fell.title: AAS Names 29 NASA-Affiliated Legacy Fellows
AAS Names 29 NASA-Affiliated Legacy Fell.desc: Twenty-nine scientists working at or affiliated with NASA have been named Fellows of the American Astronomical Society (AAS), the major organization of professional astronomers in North America.

Kepler-1649c: Earth-Size, Habitable Zone.title: Kepler-1649c: Earth-Size, Habitable Zone Planet Hides in Plain Sight
Kepler-1649c: Earth-Size, Habitable Zone.desc: This artist's illustration shows what Kepler-1649c could look like from its surface.

Earth-Size, Habitable Zone Planet Found.title: Earth-Size, Habitable Zone Planet Found Hidden in Early NASA Kepler Data
Earth-Size, Habitable Zone Planet Found.desc: A team of transatlantic scientists, using reanalyzed data from NASA’s Kepler space telescope, has discovered an Earth-size exoplanet orbiting in its star's habitable zone, the area around a star where a rocky planet could support liquid water.

New Deep Learning Method Adds 301 Planet.title: New Deep Learning Method Adds 301 Planets to Kepler's Total Count
New Deep Learning Method Adds 301 Planet.desc: Scientists recently added a whopping 301 newly confirmed exoplanets to the total exoplanet tally.

NASA\u2019s TESS Tunes into an All-sky \.title: NASA’s TESS Tunes into an All-sky ‘Symphony’ of Red Giant Stars
NASA\u2019s TESS Tunes into an All-sky \.desc: Using NASA’s Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite, astronomers have identified a vast collection of pulsating red giant stars that will help us explore our galactic neighborhood.

Planetary Sleuthing Finds Triple-Star Wo.title: Planetary Sleuthing Finds Triple-Star World
Planetary Sleuthing Finds Triple-Star Wo.desc: Years after its detection, astronomers have confirmed a planet called KOI-5Ab orbiting in a triple-star system with a skewed configuration.

About Half of Sun-Like Stars Could Host.title: About Half of Sun-Like Stars Could Host Rocky, Potentially Habitable Planets
About Half of Sun-Like Stars Could Host.desc: According to new research using data from NASA’s retired planet-hunting mission, the Kepler space telescope, about half the stars similar in temperature to our Sun could have a rocky planet capable of supporting liquid water on its surface.

NASA Awards SETI Institute Contract for.title: NASA Awards SETI Institute Contract for Planetary Protection Support
NASA Awards SETI Institute Contract for.desc: NASA has awarded the SETI Institute in Mountain View, California, a contract to support all phases of current and future planetary protection missions to ensure compliance with planetary protection standards.

Gravity Assist: Puffy Planets, Powerful.title: Gravity Assist: Puffy Planets, Powerful Telescopes, with Knicole Colon
Gravity Assist: Puffy Planets, Powerful.desc: NASA astrophysicist Knicole Colon describes her work on the Kepler, Hubble, TESS and Webb missions, and takes us on a tour of some of her favorite planets.

Imagining Another Earth.title: Imagining Another Earth
Imagining Another Earth.desc: This artist's concept shows exoplanet Kepler-1649c orbiting around its host red dwarf star.
